Here's a short biography of Sarah Michelle Gellar:

Sarah Michelle Gellar was born on April 14, 1977, in Long Island, New York. From a young age, she was fascinated by the world of acting and began taking dance and singing classes. She landed her first role at the age of 4, playing a minor character in the TV series "All My Children".

As she grew older, Gellar's talent and dedication earned her more substantial roles. At 14, she was cast as Kendall Hart on the ABC soap opera "All My Children", a role that earned her multiple Daytime Emmy nominations. Her portrayal of the spirited and ambitious Kendall Hart earned her a loyal fan base and critical acclaim.

After her successful stint on "All My Children", Gellar made the transition to prime-time television, starring as Buffy Summers, the titular character in the hit WB series "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" (1997-2003). Her performance as the strong-willed and courageous teenager who saves the world from supernatural forces, earned her numerous awards and nominations, including a Golden Globe nomination.

Gellar's success on "Buffy" led to a string of film roles, including "I Know What You Did Last Summer" (1997), "Cruel Intentions" (1999), and "The Grudge" (2004). She has also appeared in a range of independent films and TV shows, including "Veronika Decides to Die" (2009) and "Star Wars: The Old Republic" (2012).

Throughout her career, Gellar has been recognized for her dedication to charitable causes, particularly in the area of children's health and education. She has been involved with several organizations, including the Starlight Children's Foundation and the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

Today, Sarah Michelle Gellar continues to act, produce, and advocate for social causes, leaving a lasting impact on the entertainment industry and inspiring generations of young actresses.

My mom was a painter, my dad a jazz musician, and my older sister a folk singer-songwriter (talk about a creative clan!).

Growing up, I was that kid who loved to put on shows for my family and friends. I'd reenact my favorite movies and TV shows, convinced I was the reincarnation of Elizabeth Taylor or Mary Tyler Moore. My parents, being the fabulous people they are, encouraged my passion for performing and enrolled me in acting classes when I was just 4 years old.

Fast forward to my early teens, I landed my first major role on the soap opera "All My Children." Who knew that playing the part of Kendall Hart would be just the beginning of my acting journey?

The '90s were a wild ride for me, starring in the hit TV show "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" as the titular heroine Buffy Summers.
